verse: The Song of Moses and Miriam. Moses and the children of Israel therefore sang this song to the Lord:

When the horses of Pharaoh, his chariots, and his horsemen went into the sea, the Lord brought the waters of the sea back upon them, while the children of Israel walked through the midst of the sea on dry ground.
Miriam the prophetess, the sister of Aaron, took a tambourine in her hand, and all the other women came out after her playing their tambourines and dancing.
Miriam led them in the refrain:
The Waters of Marah and Elim. Moses led the children of Israel away from the Red Sea, and they traveled toward the Desert of Shur. They walked three days into the desert and they did not find water.
They arrived at Marah, but they could not drink the waters of Marah for they were bitter. That is why the place was called Marah.
So the people murmured against Moses, saying, “What will we drink?”
He called upon the Lord, who showed him a tree. When he cast it into the water, it became sweet.
Then they arrived at Elim where there were twelve springs of water and seventy palm trees. Here they camped near the waters.
